716076-d-07-24-11-IC.Narrative: R98271-23 SPOTTED TRACK 7 AT YARD AIR AND WAS INSTRUCTED BY THE YARDMASTER TO STAY IN THE CLEAR ON THE RIGHT SIDE. YARDMASTER THEN INSTRUCTED L51971-23 AND R98271-23 THAT THE L51971-23 HAD PERMISSIONTO COME OUT OF TRACK #2 AND SHOVE HIS CUT OF CARS FOR SHELL ONTO THE SHELL LEAD. THE REAR OR NORTH END OF THE SHELL CUT, UTLX 910546 (E, RESIDUE LAST CONTAINED 1-HEXENE) CORNERED THE GTW 5861 ON THE ENGINEER'S SIDE AS THE HUMP ENGINES TRIED TO BACK UP TOWARDS 7 TRACK IN AN ACCELERATED FASHION. THE CONDUCTOR ON L51971-23 STATED THAT THE BRAKEMAN WAS IN POSITION TO LINE THE SPLIT LEAD SWITCH FOR L51971'S MOVEMENT AND ALL OTHER SWITCHES WERE LINED, BUT THE R98271 ENGINE CAME OUT SO QUICKLY, ALL HECOULD DO IS SAY STOP, STOP, STOP AND HANGING ON. THE ENGINEER ON R98271 WAS QUESTIONED IF ANYONE HADTOLD HIM TO MOVE HIS ENGINE AND THE ENGINEER STATED NO. HE HEARD THE YARDMASTER STATE HE WAS GOINGTO GIVE 7 TRACKS TO THE CARMEN AND TOOK IT UPON HIMSELF TO TR TO CLEAR 7 TRACK AND GET IN 8 TRACK SOTHE TRACK COULD GE GIVEN AWAY. GTW 5861 SPILLED APPROXIMATELY 75 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL.

TRAIN WAS STOPPED WHILE PULLING INTO THE HUGO YARD, DUE TO A ROLL BY INSPECTION WHEN THE REAR TWO LOCOMOTIVES WERE OBSERVED DERAILED. IN ADDITION TO THE EXTENSIVE TRACK DAMAGE (TIES CUT, RAIL ROLLED, PLATES AND ANCHORS BROKEN) WOODEN DECK BRIDGE AT MP 676.8 SUSTAINED HEAVY DAMAGE.

000091405-d-07-01-11-CSX.Narrative: M80530 WAS IN TRACK S01 WITH A COAL TRAIN AND HAD TO SET OUT 6 BAD ORDER CARS IN HIS TRAIN. THE CONDUCTOR LINED THE HEAD END OF THE TRAIN OUT OF TRACK S01 WITH 40 CARS. THE TRAIN PULLED NORTH TO CLEARTHE S01 S02 SWITCH. THE CONDUCTOR THEN LINED THE SWITCH TO S02 AND SHOVED SOUTH INTO THE TRACK 40 CARS. IT WAS DETERMINED THAT WHEN THE CONDUCTOR LINED THE SWITCH HE DID NOT PROPERLY LATCH THE SWITCH. WHEN CAR FURX 960594 ENTERED THE SWITCH POINT THE CAR CLIMBED THE SWITCH POINT AND THE FLANGE ROLLED ON THE RAIL FOR 16 FEET AND THEN ROLLED OFF OF THE RAIL. THE CONDUCTOR WAS ABOUT 12 CARS AWAY ANDWHEN HE SECURED AND TESTED THE FIRST SHOP CAR DOWN HE DIRECTED THE ENGINEER TO GO NORTH TO CLEAR THE SWITCH. THE CONDUCTOR NOTICED A DUST CLOUD WHILE THE TRAIN WAS GOING NORTH AND INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO STOP. AFTER FURX 960594 DERAILED AND THEN STARTED NORTH IT GAPPED THE SWITCH POINTS AND THENEXT 10 CARS FELL IN THE TRACK AT THE SWITCH POINTS.

07122011-d-07-12-11-AGCR.Narrative: UNION PACIFIC CREW PULLING RBMGO-11 FROM BECKMANN AT 0224 ON JULY 12, 2011. CREW PULLED TRAIN ABOUT2000 FT WHEN A WEB HEAD VERTICAL BRAKE ACCURED ON #3 TRACK ON THE WEST SIDE OF RAIL LOADOUT ON THE INSIDE RAIL OF THE CURVE. THIS CAUSED MWAX 4596  FRONT WHEEL SET TO FALL IN THE INSIDE OF THE FLANGE.THIS CAUSED THE RAIL TO ROLL OVER, WE HAD A TOTAL OF 26 WHEELS FROM A CUT OF 20 CARS HIT THE GROUND. 40 CARS WENT OVER THIS SECTION OF RAIL, WHEN THE 71ST CAR CAME OFF AT THE DEFECTIVE RAIL BREAK.  ENGINEER THROTTLED UP TO #5 AND CONDUCTOR TOLD HIM TO STOP, BECAUSE SPARKS WERE COMING FROM RAIL UNDER LOCOMOTIVES. ENGINEER CUT 6 PIECES OF RAIL WERE LOCOMOTIVES LAID DOWN. UNION PACIFIC ENGINEER HADTROULBLE PULLING AND DIDN'T NOTICE THAT HE WAS ON THE GROUND TIL CREW CALLED A CARRY ALL TO WATCH HIS SHOVE.

THEY THEN STRETCHED AND STARTED SHOVING THE WHOLE CUT OF 126 CARS INTO 310 WHEN THEY SAW DUST AND STOPPED THE MOVEMENT. UPON INVESTIGATION THEY FOUND FOUR CARS DERAILED. CANAC AND LOCOMOTIVE DOWNLOADS SHOW NO ISSUES WITH TRAIN OPERATIONS OR PROFILE. IT WAS DETERMINEDTHAT THE COMBINATION OF THE DEGREE OF THE TURN-OUT WITH THE TOTAL WEIGHT OF THE CONSIST BEING SHOVED CAUSED AN EMPTY AUTO RACK TO BE LIFTED OFF THE RAIL.

120539-d-07-24-11-ATK.Primary Accident Cause: Fire, other than vandalism, involving on-track equipment
120539-d-07-24-11-ATK.Accident Cause: Fire, other than vandalism, involving on-track equipment
120539-d-07-24-11-ATK.Narrative: A DEFECT IN THE TRACK ALLOWED THE RUNNING RAIL TO SINK UNDER LOAD, CAUSING THE TRUCK MOUNTED 3RD RAIL SHOE TO DROP BELOW ITS NORMAL ADJUSTED HIEGHT.  THIS ALLOWED THE 3RD RAIL SHOE OF THE 706 TO COMEIN CONTACT WITH A DIVERGING TRACK WHILE THE LEFT SIDE 3RD RAIL WAS ENERGIZED, CAUSING A DIRECT SHORTTO GROUND.  THIS CONDITION WAS OBSERVED WITH A DM32 OPERATING OVER THIS AREA AFTER THE 706 INCIDENTAND EARLIER EMPIRE TRAINS THAT DAY HAD TRIPPED THE 3RD RAIL CIRCUIT IN SUNNYSIDE YARD.  AS THE ARCING OF THE R1 SHOE ASSEMBLY CONTINUED, THE FIBERGLASS INSULATING SHOE PADDLE THAT HOLDS THE IRON SHOEAGAINST THE RAIL WAS FLASHED AND LOST ITS INSULATING PROPERTIES.  NOW THE SHOE MECHANISM BECAME A CONDUCTOR AND CONTINUED TO ALLOW 3RD RAIL CURRENT TO FLOW TO THE LOCOMOTIVE CAR BODY.  THIS FAULT CAUSED THE R1 3RD RAIL AREA TO MELT THE 140 PSI AIR LINE, SUBSEQUENTLY BLOWING AIR INTO THE ARC AND FIRE, CAUSING BURNING DEBRIS TO BE THROWN AROUND THAT SIDE OF THE TRUCK AND INTO THE CAR BODY.

THE INVESTIGATION FOUND THE REAR CAR NATX 301967 CONTAINING DENATURED ALCOHOL HAD DERAILED AND ROLLED 180 DEGREES OVER ON ITS SIDE BETWEEN US 24 AND THE MAIN LINE.  A SMALL LEAK WAS DETECTED AND LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENTS PLACED A BUCKET UNDER THE TOP HATCH. 227291-d-07-22-11-DME.Narrative: TRAIN 170-20 PULLED INTO 1 TRACK AT THE NORTH END OF OTTUMWA YARD.  THEY WERE BLOCKED BY A U.P. TRAIN ON 2 TRACK AT THE SOUTH END.  THEY HAD THE U.P. TRAIN BLOCKED AT THE NORTH END.  THEY MADE A CUT ON THE REAR END OF THEIR TRAIN, PULLED AHEAD SO THE U.P. TRAIN COULD PULL THROUGH THE CROSSOVER SWITCHES AT THE NORTH END OF THE YARD AND LEAVE TOWN.  THE U.P. TRAIN WAS HEADING NORTH TO DAVENPORT.  AFTER THE U.P. TRAIN LEFT, THEY LINED THE CROSSOVER SWITCHES FOR THEIR MOVEMENT AND BACKED UP AND TIEDON TO THE REAR OF THEIR TRAIN AND STARTED TO PULL SOUTH TO LEAVE TOWN.  THEY DID NOT LINE 1 TRACK SWITCH BACK AFTER THE U.P. TRAIN LEFT FROM 2 TRACK AND SHOVED THROUGH IT.  WHEN THEY STARTED TO PULLSOUTH, THE REAR CARS STARTED TO TRACK DOWN THE LEAD INSTEAD OF 1 TRACK CAUSING CARS TO DERAIL.  DERAILMENT ALSO CAUSED UNIT CEFX 2791 TO DERAIL ON 2 TRACK.  IT WAS THE LEAD UNIT ON 577-21 THAT HAD PULLED IN ON 2 TRACK AFTER THE U.P. TRAIN DEPARTED.  FIELD #12 - LAREDO.  FIELD #30 - 2-NOT SIGNALED, 5-OTHER THAN MAIN TRACK.  FIELD #49 - OTH.
